Class Assign

java.lang.Object
Assign
public class Assign extends Object
Assign This class handles the creation of all moves in the game
Version:
Assignment Hand-In - PE7070
Author:
Lauren Scott & Byron Glover

  • Constructor Details

    • Assign

      public Assign(ConnectFour game, int col, boolean player)
      Constructor for Assign class. This gets the total number of moves and calls methods to determine the row that will be filled, and to set the state of the slot being assigned.
      Parameters:
      game - - the game
      col - - the column the user has selected
      player - - a Boolean value that determines whether it is a player/computer move

  • Method Details

    • calculateRow

      public int calculateRow(int c)
      calculateRow This method finds the lowest empty slot in the selected column, which will be assigned. Returns a negative int if no match found.
      Parameters:
      c - - the selected column
      Returns:
      the row value

    • assignMove

      public void assignMove(boolean player)
      assignMove This method assigns the move to the game
      Parameters:
      player - a Boolean value to determine whether it is a computer/player move

    • getRow

      public int getRow()
      getRow This method returns the current row value for this move. It allows another element of the program to access this move's current row.
      Returns:
      the row value

    • ableToAssign

      public boolean ableToAssign()
      ableToAssign This method returns whether the move is able to be assigned to a grid. If not, returns false.
      Returns:
      the row value
